title.rendered: Caroline Keogh elected to Marketing Society Council

content.rendered:
Starting this month, Caroline Keogh joins the Marketing Society Council for a three year term. After elections in November and December, Caroline Keogh, who is Relationship Management Director and a board member here at the agency, was voted onto the council. At Boys+Girls, Caroline runs the relationship management department and oversees all client accounts including Diageo, Kelloggs, ŠKODA and Energia. Caroline is joined on the Council by three other new members; Jennifer Power from McDonalds Ireland, Meadhbh Quinn from Pinksalmon and Laura Daley from JWT Folk.

A place on the Marketing Society council offers an opportunity to take a leading role in shaping the debate amongst the marketing and market research industry in Ireland. The position comes with an obligation to attend monthly council meetings, organise members’ events, and commit to a three-year term of office commencing in January 2020. 

The Marketing Society’s vision is to support and promote marketing through thought leadership and a fresh exchange of ideas. They offer membership and training throughout the year.

See more here:https://marketingsociety.ie/home
